content.description:
P1. Start up a nice hand crack in a large, left-facing dihedral system. Clip a bolt, and continue to the crux bulge. A nice moderate face leads to an anchor.

P2. Climb a slightly crumbly face above the anchors (crux) staying left of the clips. Continue up the wall to a set of rap anchors.

With ~22 draws, you can link both pitches together. Both cruxes are above sloping ledge systems, so be careful.
content.location: Start in a large, left-facing dihedral with a hand crack.

content.description: Climb past seven bolts up a slab with many good holds. It is a fun romp.
content.location: This is on the short wall one passes beneath before approaching the main Main Wall.

content.description: The Shearing has nice 5.10 climbing up the dihedral/arete that leads to a good rest below the roof. An option is to cut right here and head up to the anchors making the route 5.10b. For the 5.12, angle up and left over the roof to anchors.
content.location: It ascends the corner/arete to roof five feet left of Baadlands.

content.description: Start on the closely bolted slab to the left of the large, left-facing dihedral system. Angle right into the orange corner to a wild roof system. Clip a fixed draw, and make some huge moves to the anchor above.
content.protection:
12 bolts.

Eds. Consider figuring out a way to not cross load the 2nd bolt.
content.location: Start on the well-bolted, 5.10 slab left of the large dihedral system.

content.description:
This is a second pitch extension to any of the routes below. The Pony climbs the left side of a clean panel located in the the large, left-facing dihedral system. There are some amazing edges in this section of rock. The best approach pitch is

Rambo Peep

.
content.location: It is a second pitch extension in the large, left-facing dihedral system.

content.description: Tricky start leads to some easier climbing, until you find yourself in the dihedral to the left of the crispy looking hand crack. Continue up to a nice face with a short crux, just right of some blocky roofs before reaching the anchors.
content.location:
It is the 2nd route left of the large roof that ‘

The Shearing

’ climbs through. This route is super easy to spot because of the unique hand crack feature.

content.description:
Climb

Rambo Peep

or one of the routes to its left up the dihedral past

The Pony

to anchors. Follow the left line of bolts up and left past the crux to easier climbing to the anchors. This can be done in one pitch with a 70m rope.

Two raps with a 70m rope are needed to descend.
content.location:
This is the left of two routes starting left of the anchors on

The Pony

.

content.description: Follow a face to the left of the arete. There are two boulder problem cruxes with easier climbing in between. A #1 Camalot can be placed to avoid a runout after the second crux.
content.location: Hike up the trail past a couple short switchbacks.
It is located on a slab high on the wall to the left of the large, left-facing dihedral system.

content.description:
Climb the obvious, V-corner crack to a high first bolt then through two small roofs with two more bolts. Finish at the anchors below

The Pony

.
content.location:
This route is located between

I Shall Not Want

and

Bitter Clinger

.

content.description: Start up the first 4-5 bolts of the Shearing (5.12a), and branch left to a hand crack. Place a #2 Camalot, and start clipping bolts again for the crux roof and face section at the top. There is some kitty litter rock on the left that can be avoided. The upper section is very fun!
content.location: It is on the far right side of the wall.

content.description:
Days Between Us has fun climbing through a big roof.

Climb up to the roof (the right route of two going through the roof that have chain draws), then pull through the somewhat thuggish crux and up to the anchors.
content.location: It is the last route on the left before you start heading uphill.

content.description:
The Burro is a nice start on

Rambo Peep

that then climbs a great arete.

Climb

Rambo Peep

to where it cuts right to the roof. Move left, and climb the arete to anchors shared with

The Pony

. There is an optional belay out left prior to starting up the arete.
content.location:
Start on

Rambo Peep

, then climb the arete to the left.

content.description: Dirty Work has solid laybacking to start into two fun roofs.
content.location: It is on the left main wall. An obvious, arching layback crack marks the start.

content.description: Follow the obvious arete with an offset dihedral system. The climbing is harder than it looks from the ground.   combination of creative body positions, stemming, and arete moves will take you to a mantel and easier climbing.
content.location: It is partway up the hill to the left of the main trail.
